name: Roadrunner
mantra: I move unseen; my timing is true.
movement: Light zig-zag steps, crossing feet to trace an X—become untrackable.
meaning: The Roadrunner carries messages across thresholds. It asks you to act with quick clarity and to keep your path untrackable to energies that do not serve you. Watch for signs; move when the moment opens.
reversed: Haste, scattered focus, or broadcasting your path too loudly. Slow down; choose one clear action.

name: Snake
mantra: I am the life beneath the skin.
movement: Lie close to the ground, breathe deep, rise with a slow undulating spine—feel the new skin.
meaning: Snake is sacred transformation: shedding what is finished while keeping your essence. Venom is medicine in right dose—integrate shadow into healing.
reversed: Avoidance of change, clinging to the old skin, fear of your own power. Begin a small shedding.

name: Owl
movement: Stand tall, soften gaze, turn head slowly side to side, then close eyes and listen.
meaning: Owl brings luminous sight in the dark. Pause; listen beneath the noise. Guidance is present when you choose quiet vision over reaction.
reversed: Illusion, projection, or fear-led guesses. Return to stillness before moving.

name: Jaguar
mantra: My power is quiet and precise.
movement: Low, strong steps; shoulders relaxed; eyes soft but focused—move only when it is time.
meaning: Jaguar guards the edge between worlds. Conserve your force, wait in the shadows, then act cleanly and once.
reversed: Posturing, scattered force, or striking without aim. Return to stillness to regain accuracy.

name: Fox Pair
mantra: We move as one—light, alert, and kind.
movement: Side-step lightly, mirror your partner’s motion; practice silent sync for three breaths.
meaning: The Fox Pair teaches relational agility. Blend play with strategy; listen with your whole body; adapt together.
reversed: Misdirection or mixed signals. Speak plainly; reset the rhythm before moving.

name: Killdeer
movement: Step forward with a clear ‘no,’ then angle away—practicing a clean redirection.
meaning: Killdeer feigns a broken wing to draw danger from the nest. Protect what’s tender by skillfully redirecting attention.
reversed: People-pleasing or porous boundaries. Say the true no; defend the vulnerable directly.

name: Crow
mantra: The stories remember me; I remember them.
movement: Hands to temples, then open palms outward as if releasing a story to the sky.
meaning: Crow keeps the shared memory between worlds. What you do echoes. Tell the true story; let the rest fly.
reversed: Old narratives looping. Break the spell by naming the present moment clearly.
